channel.title: Ivman not found?
channel.description:
[s]I installed Arch with fluxbox, and now when I browse with FireFox it the fonts look of bad quality. Like when you zoom out with ctrl + mouse wheel. On Windows they kind of look like vector images, you know, with smooth edges. But on my Arch they don't. How do I fix this?
And a second question: Some pages, including www.moparisthebest.com, are filled with chinese signs instead of normal characters. Something similar happens to openoffice, where everything is filled with [][][][] instead of normal letters. After I start up openoffice, it crashes within a minute.[/s]
Edit: I think I'll make this thread continuos one. I'll edit the first post when I have a new question, or when I fixed my problem, as you can already see. Unless you guys think I shouldn't, then I'll make a new thread everytime I run into a new problem.
Edit 2: I have an external hdd connected to my laptop via usb. For some reason it isn't detected, so I read somewhere that I had to install ivman. So I did. But when I try to run it, it doesn't recognize it. But when I do 'man ivman' I do get a manual page. What the hell am I doing wrong?

item.title: Ivman not found?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

chrisn2323:

Read the beginners manual, there’s a section about setting up xorg properly and adding fonts.

Thanks, I missed that part.

Read full topic

item.title: Ivman not found?

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Read the beginners manual, there’s a section about setting up xorg properly and adding fonts.

item.title: Ivman not found?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[s]I installed Arch with fluxbox, and now when I browse with FireFox it the fonts look of bad quality. Like when you zoom out with ctrl + mouse wheel. On Windows they kind of look like vector images, you know, with smooth edges. But on my Arch they don’t. How do I fix this?

And a second question: Some pages, including www.moparisthebest.com, are filled with chinese signs instead of normal characters. Something similar happens to openoffice, where everything is filled with [][][][] instead of normal letters. After I start up openoffice, it crashes within a minute.[/s]

Edit: I think I’ll make this thread continuos one. I’ll edit the first post when I have a new question, or when I fixed my problem, as you can already see. Unless you guys think I shouldn’t, then I’ll make a new thread everytime I run into a new problem.

Edit 2: I have an external hdd connected to my laptop via usb. For some reason it isn’t detected, so I read somewhere that I had to install ivman. So I did. But when I try to run it, it doesn’t recognize it. But when I do ‘man ivman’ I do get a manual page. What the hell am I doing wrong?

Read full topic
